WorkItem.Description:
The MigraDoc.Rendering.ParagraphRenderer.ProbeAfterDecimalAlignedTab method miscalculates alignment for negative numbers used with decimal aligned tab-stops. This happens because the document model produces two text elements for a negative number, and the probe method only accounts for the first one.
The first element is for the negation sign, the second is the actual number.
Â 
The probe method should at least check for a number sign element and if the next element is a text element. If this is the case, then the string used for alignment should include the text from both elements. I have included a diff for ParagraphRenderer.cs that appears to fix this issue.
WorkItem.Summary: Decimal Tab Stops With Negative Numbers
